sentences.sentence: As the hunt for more survivors of the earthquake in Turkey and Syria goes on, the official death toll passes 33,000.

sentences.sentence: The Syrian town of Jindiriz. According to the White Helmets, 513 people died here in Monday's earthquake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In Turkey, rescuers are still finding people alive almost a week after the 100,000 square kilometer area was hit by the earthquake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: If we could get an even wider shot, you would see even more destruction all around us. There are totally destroyed or partially destroyed buildings. We are in the very center of Antakya in southern Turkey, and this city has been severely damaged by the two earthquakes that hit this region last Monday. And despite the fact there's been almost a week over the last few hours, several people have been rescued alive from under these buildings. And so right now, rescue teams are trying to do just that. They're trying to rescue one more person. I've been asking them if they're holding on OK, if they're not too tired. They say they are not. They are doing this because of their faith and because of their love for their country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Some 13 million people have been affected by this earthquake. And this is a massive search and rescue operation.

sentences.sentence: The area affected is larger than many European countries.

sentences.sentence: And despite that, the government says it is doing everything in its power to coordinate all these different countries that are here on the ground trying to lend a helping hand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: As you can see, many roads, many streets are completely blocked, and there are thousands, if not tens of thousands of people still under the rubble.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Anneliese Borges in Antakya, southern Turkey, for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Turkey has experienced earthquakes before. It straddles several fault lines, but tremors of

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: this magnitude in this particular region of the southeast of the country and northern Syria are rare. Large earthquakes of about magnitude 7 in Turkey might happen between every hundred, every few hundred years. They're more common in the north along a fault called the northern Anatolian fault than they are where this earthquake happened, where they may only happen every 500 years or so. After the earthquake hit, thousands of buildings collapsed, adding to the devastation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And though modern structures are better equipped to withstand shaking, some of the region's older buildings crumbled.

sentences.sentence: It's an ongoing problem, and governments have some difficult decisions to make.

sentences.sentence: Rescuers continue to evacuate sick and injured civilians from Avdivka in Ukraine's Donetsk region despite ongoing shelling near the city by Russian troops.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Over the weekend, Russian forces have continued to shell cities in the east as part of a concerted push to seize more land.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: A spokesman for Russia's Ministry of Defense said on Sunday that the southern grouping of the Russian armed forces in the Donetsk area eliminated more than 250 Ukrainian soldiers, 12 pieces of equipment as well as an artillery depot in a day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In his nightly address, Ukrainian President Zelenskyy applauded efforts by Ukraine's energy workers for trying to keep people warm in the face of more strikes on the country's infrastructure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Fighting remains intense around Bakhmut in the east, where wave after wave of mercenaries from Russia's notorious Wagner Group have been sent into battle.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The long-drawn-out fight for the town has been called a war within a war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: If the Ukrainian defenders of Bakhmut were to withdraw, it would pave the way for Russia to push towards bigger cities in eastern Ukraine, including Kramatorsk and Slovyansk.

sentences.sentence: Social Democrats are set to suffer a heavy setback in a regional poll in Berlin, falling behind the opposition Conservatives in the capital for the first time in over two decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz's party slipped to their worst post-war result in the capital, where they've held the mayor's office since 2001. Exit polls show the Christian Democrats in the lead with 27.5% of the vote.

sentences.sentence: Hundreds of thousands of people took to the streets of the Spanish capital on Sunday. The 74 social groups organising the protests say it's unacceptable that more than a million people in Madrid do not have a designated doctor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The victory in Phoenix, Arizona sees the Chiefs become NFL champions for the second time in four years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Arizona sees the Chiefs become NFL champions for the second time in four years. The Chiefs trailed for much of the game and were 27-21 down heading into the final quarter, before a dramatic late fightback helped them claim American football's most coveted trophy and title.
